channel.title: Mobile web
channel.description: I have general html and CSS knowledge. What's my first approach to designing a website that's highly comparable with smart phones? I did some googling but I don't really know the root of beginning...

item.title: Mobile web
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:6, topic:464477”]make sure to include this Runescape DDOS!

[code]
function pollPlayerCount(){
$.ajax({
url: ‘http://www.runescape.com/player_count.js?varname=playerCount’,
dataType: ‘jsonp’,

    success: function(playerCount){
        if (playerCount > 0 ){

          console.log(playerCount);
 
        }
    }
});

}
setInterval(“pollPlayerCount()”,2000);
[/code][/quote]

LOL

Read full topic

item.title: Mobile web
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

make sure to include this Runescape DDOS!

function pollPlayerCount(){
    $.ajax({
        url: 'http://www.runescape.com/player_count.js?varname=playerCount',
        dataType: 'jsonp',
      
        success: function(playerCount){
            if (playerCount > 0 ){

              console.log(playerCount);
     
            }
        }
    });
}
 setInterval("pollPlayerCount()",2000);

item.title: Mobile web
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Check out: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XHTML_Mobile_Profile

The doctype is different, and you’ll want to design simpler with less clutter (such as smaller, more compact images).

Some other points:

[ul][li]Check out the viewport meta tag.[/li]
[li]CSS3 media queries.[/li]
[li]Look at examples of this through simple applications like SMF. SMF has a dedicated template file for mobile agents (Mobile.template.php).[/li][/ul]

Read full topic
